video.title: TED Talks: Sex, Secrets & Love
video.synopsis: Experts and humorists speak candidly about sex, love and attraction, with insights that are as surprising as they are delightful.

episodes.synopsis: Bonk author Mary Roach delves into obscure scientific research to make 10 surprising claims about sexual climax.
episodes.title: Mary Roach: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Orgasm

episodes.synopsis: An anthropologist takes on love and explains its evolution, its biochemical foundations and its social importance.
episodes.title: Helen Fisher: Why We Love and Cheat

episodes.synopsis: The publishers of Babble.com expose four facts that parents never, ever admit -- and why they should.
episodes.title: Rufus Griscom & Alisa Volkman: Let's Talk Parenting Taboos

episodes.synopsis: Brené Brown shares a deep insight that sent her on a personal quest to know herself, as well as to understand humanity.
episodes.title: Brené Brown: The Power of Vulnerability

episodes.synopsis: What drives our desire to behave morally? A neuroeconomist believes oxytocin is "the moral molecule."
episodes.title: Paul Zak: Trust, Morality and Oxytocin

episodes.synopsis: Comedian Julia Sweeney is forced to tell a little white lie when her 8-year-old begins learning about frog reproduction.
episodes.title: Julia Sweeney Has 'The Talk'

episodes.synopsis: Why are babies cute? Why is cake sweet? Philosopher Dan Dennett has answers you wouldn't expect.
episodes.title: Dan Dennett: Cute, Sexy, Sweet, Funny

episodes.synopsis: We worry that texting and Facebook are spoiling human intimacy, but Stefana Broadbent's research shows a different picture.
episodes.title: Stefana Broadbent: How the Internet Enables Intimacy

episodes.synopsis: A humorist tells a story about how aliens, physics, time and space contribute to a sweet memory of falling in love.
episodes.title: John Hodgman: Aliens, Love -- Where Are They?

episodes.synopsis: Thailand's "Mr. Condom" gives a frank, funny -- and very effective -- talk about condoms.
episodes.title: Mechai Viravaidya: How Mr. Condom Made Thailand a Better Place

episodes.synopsis: Working with people at the edge of anatomy such as intersexuals, Alice Dreger asks: Why do we let anatomy determine our fate?
episodes.title: Alice Dreger: Is Anatomy Destiny?

episodes.synopsis: Esther Perel argues that good committed sex draws on conflicting needs: our need for security and our need for surprise. So how do you sustain desire?
episodes.title: Esther Perel: The Secret to Desire in a Long-Term Relationship

episodes.synopsis: Hear the story of how digital strategist Amy Webb hacked her online dating life -- with frustrating, funny and life-changing results.
episodes.title: Amy Webb: How I Hacked Online Dating

episodes.synopsis: Author Christopher Ryan walks us through the controversial evidence that human beings are sexual omnivores by nature.
episodes.title: Christopher Ryan: Are We Designed to Be Sexual Omnivores?

episodes.synopsis: Author Shereen El Feki wonders if a reemergence of public dialogue could lead to more satisfying, and safer, sex lives in the Arab world.
episodes.title: Shereen El Feki: A Little-Told Tale of Sex and Sensuality

episodes.synopsis: Philosopher Yann Dall'Aglio explores the universal search for tenderness and connection in a world that's ever more focused on the individual.
episodes.title: Yann Dall'Aglio: Love - You're Doing It Wrong

episodes.synopsis: Diane Kelly makes clear that there are basic facts about the human body we're still learning. Case in point: How does the mammalian erection work?
episodes.title: Diane Kelly: What We Didn't Know About Penis Anatomy
